abstract.p: Popular Demand column on popularity of books by Norman Mailer; discusses Mailer's newest novel Castle in the Forest; author's books in order of popularity are listed; photo (S)

block.p: Norman Mailer, who has written about wars, politicians, celebrity, culture and, of course, good vs. evil, takes on one of the most notorious figures of the 20th century in ''The Castle in the Forest.'' The novel, to be released tomorrow, is a speculative look at the childhood that shaped Adolf Hitler.

Mr. Mailer's name has often been invoked as shorthand commentary on war, ego, the sexes and high and low culture. He is mentioned in everything from ''Give Peace a Chance'' by John Lennon to the TV show ''King of the Hill.''
